title: How to improve my writing skills - Writing & Blogging - Quora

response.answer_text: The tried and true and trite advice: READ. Read what you love, what engrosses you, what you can’t put down. You will pick up on things like style, voice, cadence, crafting. It will give you ideas and help you write as well as you read. It takes time, but it works. Also, read works (short stories included) by various authors. Just to throw a few out there: Ray Bradbury, Flannery O’Connor, Kate Chopin, Ernest Hemingway, William Faulkner, John Steinbeck, and Harper Lee. You will gain an understanding and feel for different writing styles and it will help you develop your own. WRITE. Write often, write everyday. Who cares if it’s not brilliant at first, or if it’s astounding one day and so-so the next. Writing is not just a skill or talent, it’s a muscle that gets stronger and more defined as we use it. Most of all, have fun. Follow your joy and love in reading and writing. You will improve! You could also take a writing class and/or attend a few workshops. You could join a local writer’s group, or discern a good one online - competent writers that know how to give constructive feedback. Remember to have fun while you work. It shouldn’t be tedious. It should be work that you love so much it doesn’t feel like work. Happy writing!

CAN I IMPROVE MY WRITING SKILLS?:Can I improve my writing skills beyond the skills I’ve gotSuch that my writing gives me chills and thrills me on-the-spot?Can I express true happiness, gladness and sadness, too,Such that in time I come to bless my readers just like you?Can I transport us to the stars and planets out of sightSuch that we learn what comes to pass out there by day and night?Can I reach out beyond the page, beyond the InternetSuch that no matter what your age God’s wisdom you can get?Can I explain the complex things in words most understandSuch that I share the King of Kings and what the Lord has planned?:Can I reveal what’s good as gold, the facts you need to know,Such that new stories can be told before my time to go?Can I set free the finest themes from my mind then to yoursSuch that you see these more than dreams and true faith reassures?Can I do more through prayer and love with brand new poetrySuch that in time I’ve done enough to leave a legacy?If yes, then I must take my time to meditate a while,Before I write what proves sublime, perhaps to make you smile.It’s up to me to bless Mankind each time I do my partAs long as rhymes stay on my mind and nestle in my heart…:Denis Martindale July 2020.: denismartindale—co—uk tinyurl—com/denis-martindale-poetry tinyurl—com/denis-martindale-poems:

Well I can’t answer this in the three minutes I’ve got tonight, since the answer is complex and a legion of writers have already written hundreds of books on the topic — including me. I think you should find a good book on the topic, plan a quiet weekend and read it. That would be a good start to self improvement.
